It is a coniferous evergreen tree that typically grows in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil. The tree has slender, needle-like leaves that are dark green and arranged spirally along the branches. Its cones are small and cylindrical, containing winged seeds that are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Abies rolii is considered a vulnerable species.
